name: NPR
text:
Update: Falwell has not responded to NPR. But in an interview with Virginia Business, he contradicted the university official ‚Äî saying reports that he has agreed to resign are "completely false."
https://t.co/YkMZQ6CDt3

name: NPR
text:
Some Democrats say the RNC's decision to hold speeches on federal land may cause staffers to run afoul with an ethics law that prohibits most federal employees from engaging in political activity while on duty or in a government building.
https://t.co/5ZhOTrxVTi

name: NPR
text: WATCH LIVE: The first night of the Republican National Convention. https://t.co/fX8UUl3I4r

name: NPR
text:
The first night of the RNC is underway ‚Äî with speeches from Donald Trump Jr., Rep. Jim Jordan, Sen. Tim Scott and Nikki Haley.

Watch the event live, and follow along as NPR reporters provide analysis. https://t.co/Pe316LN4xv

name: NPR
text:
This Maine county has reported fewer than 40 coronavirus cases since March.

But even here, going back to school looks different ‚Äî including half the students attending school in the morning, half in the afternoon, and temperature checks before class.
https://t.co/Dp5ShFoGiT

name: NPR
text:
A coffee shop owner, Tanya Weinreis, spoke at the #RNC2020. She's thought to be the first business owner in Montana to qualify for a PPP loan, which helped her keep 50 employees on payroll during the pandemic.
https://t.co/q1QGHreZOW

name: NPR
text:
Kimberly Klacik, a Republican running for the House seat previously held by the late Rep. Elijah Cummings, spoke at the #RNC2020.

She is running against Rep. Kweisi Mfume, the former head of the NAACP, who defeated her in an April special election. https://t.co/Q8HoLHSVex

name: NPR
text:
Charlie Kirk, co-founder of Turning Point USA, heralded Donald Trump as the ‚Äúdefender of Western civilization" at the RNC.

The Anti-Defamation League and SPLC note that Turning Point USA members have been linked to extremist and white nationalist groups. https://t.co/nOi32Qd61L

name: NPR
text:
Cardinal Timothy Dolan, the Archbishop of New York, gave the opening prayer of the #RNC2020 ‚Äî despite criticism of his association with President Trump.

In a statement, Dolan defended the move, claiming it didn't constitute an endorsement on his part. https://t.co/iIMrkEwzeR

name: NPR
text: Speaking at the #RNC2020, Ohio Rep. Jim Jordan ‚Äî¬†one of President Trump‚Äôs most forceful allies on Capitol Hill ‚Äî repeated some false claims that the Democratic ticket plans to defund the police. That isn't true. https://t.co/iVSY79i9NI

name: NPR
text:
A surgeon and coronavirus survivor praised President Trump for what he called ‚Äúdecisive leadership‚Äù during the pandemic.

More than 175,000 Americans have died from the coronavirus.
https://t.co/F8tLx9inlK

name: NPR
text:
Speaking at the #RNC2020, President Trump has repeatedly used one of several offensive and racist terms by which he has referred to the coronavirus.

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt want to go through all the names because some people may get insulted,‚Äù he said.
https://t.co/d3I6r9UF9n

name: NPR
text:
Georgia State Rep. Vernon Jones claimed that President Trump ‚Äúended ‚Äî once and for all ‚Äî the policy of mass incarceration of Black people.‚Äù That isn't true.

Trump signed a criminal justice bill in 2018. That law has not ended mass incarceration.
https://t.co/9y2IXWe0gp

name: NPR
text: Nikki Haley, the former U.N. ambassador, says President Trump has stood up for America as president and created a record of ‚Äústrength and success.‚Äù https://t.co/van2pc3oD8 https://t.co/XUx0RyEisc

name: NPR
text:
A Cuban American businessman whose family fled Fidel Castro's regime is one of several people born in socialist of communist-controlled countries to speak at the #RNC2020 this week ‚Äî as the Trump campaign tries to tie Joe Biden to socialism.
https://t.co/IskfpmxiZu

name: NPR
text:

name: NPR
text:
Donald Trump Jr. delivered a passionate defense of his father‚Äôs first term in office, blaming Democrats for being too politically correct and for clamping down on people who ‚Äúspeak their mind.‚Äù
https://t.co/DiIWBWt4cu

name: NPR
text:
NPR asked HHS Secretary Alex Azar whether he supports President Trump's baseless claim that the "deep state, or whoever, over at the FDA" is intentionally delaying access to vaccines and therapeutics to hurt his reelection chances.

Azar wouldn't say.
https://t.co/vcUwrPLY64

name: NPR
text:
Tropical Storm Laura is gaining strength and is expected to make landfall near southern Louisiana or the east Texas coastline late Wednesday. It could be the strongest storm since 2005's Hurricane Rita.
https://t.co/3RKG7JpnEB

name: NPR
text:
Nearly half of the people who attended a wedding reception in Maine earlier this month have tested positive for the coronavirus.

A woman who didn't attend the event died after contracting the virus from a guest, officials say.
https://t.co/PcuOyj4dYB

name: NPR
text:
Over the past week, more than 13,000 dry lightning strikes sparked more than 600 fires that were elevated by dry conditions in California. 250,000 people are under evacuation orders and warnings.
https://t.co/oCVdd5LJnz

text:

name: NPR
text:
More than 1.4 million acres have burned from wildfires in California. On all sides of the Bay Area, the 3 largest blazes are burrowing through forest and rural areas mostly uncontained.
https://t.co/ETpAuxTPJk

name: NPR
text: President Trump had promised an "uplifting" convention, but aside from an opening video and closing speech ‚Äî the first night painted an image of a dystopia that would take hold if Democrat Joe Biden is elected. https://t.co/85y4iY8mil

name: NPR
text:
Almost 30 million people are collecting unemployment benefits ‚Äî but President Trump is still getting high marks for handling the economy.

"What's going on is the memory of the economy before the pandemic," says a GOP pollster.
https://t.co/NXC4C9GGEq

name: NPR
text: Law enforcement has lost track of more than 25,000 convicted sex offenders and predators across the U.S., leaving their whereabouts unknown to victims and the public, an NPR investigation has found. https://t.co/7rkj7nvhra

name: NPR
text: Hurricane Laura will make landfall with winds of around 115 mph and a storm surge up to 11 feet, when it strikes near the Louisiana-Texas border late Wednesday or early Thursday, according to the National Hurricane Center. https://t.co/WnjxQX4i49

name: NPR
text:
‚ÄúWe take care of ourselves, but we also need government to help us a little bit. When the money runs out, what do I do?" 

With expanded federal unemployment benefits gone, the sudden recession is forcing many to upend their lives.
https://t.co/jVxZGlB3U8

text:

Starting at 12pm ET‚ú® https://t.co/my85JQG5b1

text:
Peaceful protests turned chaotic Monday in Kenosha, Wisconsin, after the police shooting of Jacob Blake.

Police deployed tear gas outside the city's courthouse and the governor has called in the state's National Guard.
https://t.co/lsd31b1L8O

text: The Republican National Convention kicked off with a surprise appearance by President Trump at the roll call in Cha‚Ä¶ https://t.co/EelzlBKfoB

text:

Here's what he said in 7 key battleground states:

name: NPR
text:
An uninsured Colorado veteran was billed $80,232 for two appendicitis-related surgeries. After months of negotiating with the hospital ‚Äî he still owes far more than most insurers would pay for the procedures.
https://t.co/zqktdHpQry

name: NPR
text: Jerry Falwell Jr. confirmed Tuesday that he has resigned as president of Liberty University following allegations of sexual behavior that violated the school's honor code. https://t.co/YRwJg59mJ3

name: NPR
text:
Melania Trump will headline the 2nd night of the convention in front of a small, in-person audience in the White House Rose Garden.

The first lady‚Äôs chief of staff says the speech will be "very uplifting and positive." https://t.co/9atC3kbAzm

name: NPR
text:
New York City is planning to open its doors to students ‚Äî but objections are mounting over safety.

https://t.co/6sMIcLFVWs

name: NPR
text:

Here's what socialism actually is.

name: NPR
text:
Postal Service delays have created immediate worries for those who depend on it for prescriptions.

It ‚Äúcould mean the difference between a patient being in the hospital, and a patient being in the ground," says a pharmacist.
https://t.co/GmgFsmYhe3

name: NPR
text:
President Trump says he will officially nominate Chad Wolf to be DHS secretary.

The move comes less than two weeks after the GAO concluded that Wolf ‚Äî who has been serving in his role without Senate confirmation ‚Äî wasn't appointed through a valid process.
https://t.co/RHxV41ta8S
